Despues de todo es un buen juego y lo recomiendo.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS GAME!!! Definitely worth the time and money to buy, but the second game, Left 4 Dead 2, has more better content and more specialized zombies. Still super fun!
The only thing to note is if you're playing with all AI caracters (computers), they tend to get in the way a lot and friendly fire can a bit of a problem occasionally, and constant playthroughs can get a little bogged down.. 
Would definitely give a 10/10

The cooperative multiplayer isn't very good if you are new to the game. The menu says you will be put into a group similar to zour experience in the game. Well, that is not true. In the beginning I was put into a group playing some hard difficulty, had no idea what was going on and spent most time dead. But then I played solo with 3 AI and realized how amazing the is and had lots of fun. The amount of zombies you get to kill is hilarious and the headshots never get old. This game really makes me grin and I like it.

Bom Jogo Divertido.

So considering my last few reviews have been rather comical and satyrical, I think I'll go ahead and actually get to the point with this one.

Gonna start this off by saying that this is easily one of the [b] greatest multiplayer experiences [/b] ever if you're down for simple gameplay controls, wonderful shifting AIs and just absolute nonsense and zombies.

[b] Gameplay: [/b] This game, definitely has some amazing gameplay. Virtually anybody can pick this game up and hop on in. That being in the context of controls, story and action. AIs consistenly shift every time you play the game giving the illusion of constant replayability. Adding more players doesn't even hinder the experience like some games do. Whether its joining your friends in destroying the horde or going head to head with friends to see whose the better infected.

[b] Controls: [/b] AMAZING (in my opinion, at least). Unlike a lot of people, my first run through of Left 4 Dead was actually on Xbox. Which everyone knows that basically any shooter naturally feels halfway decent on the controller, when you're on the PC, that's a slightly different story. However these controls were insanely easy to catch on to. To the point where I found the spray paint buttong and changed the picture of it in mere seconds of loading it after the first install. Shooting, shifting through guns, melee and crouch. Pretty much all you need. Plus, other games could definitely learn a thing or 2 about the inventory scroll system that Valve uses for Left 4 Dead. Much more convinient than most games.

[b] Final Opinion: [/b] Wonderful. It's just that. Wonderful. There's pretty much no downfall to this game (somewhat besides the stale factor that can happen after accumulating 20-30+ hours. But with enough friends, this can easily be cured. But this game I hold close to me for many reasons. That first No Mercy level will always be burned into the back of my skull and never really loses its fun no matter how many times I play it. So pretty much, Left 4 Dead, is in its own little weird way, kinda perfect.

[b] Yeah [/b]

Hey guys!  So, put together a video review of Left 4 Dead with the main goal is establishing is this a game worth getting in 2016?  Really the short answer unfortunately for me was no and the most basic reason was that the game is primarily a multiplayer game and with the shortage of mods for the original game it just doesn't leave enough meat on the bones to pickup.  I do, however, think this was one of the better games of that era but now it falls short on the wishlist of games to pickup.  If you are a zombie fan and love owning all games zombie related this is still an above average title in the slew of zombie titles out there to play at least once.

Here is the video
https://youtu.be/iGqfoySNiI8

If you have an option between getting Left4Dead or Left4Dead2(aka L4D2), just get L4D2. It has all of the campaigns from this game for FREE, and they're updated with the additional content and gameplay mechanics of the second game.

If you're a diehard fanboy, get it, but if you're a diehard fanboy, you've already made up your mind and are just reading this review for your own validation.
